titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Houston Area Fiber Artists Records
titlestmt.author: Julia Taylor

titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Houston Area Fiber Artists Records 1968/2014

did.head: Overview of the Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

did.abstract: This collection contains materials related to organizational structure of the Houston Area Fiber Artists (HAFA), such as meeting minutes, financial records, secretarial records, membership lists, and more. There is also extensive photographic documentation of various art pieces created by HAFA members, as well as a number of VHS tapes and DVDs showcasing this material.

bioghist.head: Historical Note:
bioghist.p: The Houston Area Fiber Artists (HAFA) was federated in 1969 as an organization involved in the creation of original design in fiber media with the purpose of maintaining and advancing fiber as an art form. Mediums included knitting, sewing, embroidery, and more. Profits from fundraising activities were used for scholarships and support of educational programs. In December of 2014, the organization disbanded and is now a focus group of the Contemporary Handweavers of Houston.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use:
userestrict.p: Special Collections owns the physical items in our collections, but copyright normally belongs to the creator of the materials or their heirs. The researcher has full responsibility for determining copyright status, locating copyright holders, and abiding by current copyright laws when publishing or displaying copies of Special Collections material in print or electronic form. For more information, consult the appropriate librarian.
Photocopy decisions will be made by Special Collections staff on a case-by-case basis. Patrons are responsible for obtaining permission to publish from copyright holders.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Information of acquisition method not available.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: Houston Area Fiber Artists Records. Courtesy of Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics or Technical Requirements:
phystech.p: This collection includes digital archival materials, which can be accessed in the Special Collections Reading Room by advance request. These materials may require up to one week to access. Contact curator Vince Lee at velee@Central.UH.EDU for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials related to organizational structure of the Houston Area Fiber Artists (HAFA), such as meeting minutes, financial records, secretarial records, membership lists, and more. There is also extensive photographic documentation of various art pieces created by HAFA members, as well as a number of VHS tapes and DVDs showcasing this material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This Series contains media in a variety of formats, including slides, VHS tapes, and digital materials. Sub-series 2 contains VHS tapes. Due to the fragility of the media, please contact curator Vince lee (velee@Central.UH.EDU) to inquire about viewing the tapes. Sub-series 3, 4, and 5 include digital archival materials. These arrived in the archives in the form of CDs, DVDs, flash drives, and 3.5" floppy disks. The contents have been transferred off these fragile media, but the media type is retained in the finding aid to reflect the original format and organization of the files. The digital files can be accessed in the Special Collections Reading Room by advance request. These materials may require up to one week to access. Contact curator Vince Lee (velee@Central.UH.EDU) for more information.
Due to the fragile nature of the media, please contact curator Vince Lee (velee@Central.UH.EDU) with questions about viewing these materials.

scopecontent.p: The digital files from these CDs and DVDs can be accessed in the Special Collections Reading Room by advance request. These materials may require up to one week to access. Contact curator Vince Lee (velee@Central.UH.EDU) for more information. When possible, CD titles in this finding aid have been taken directly from hand-written notes or labels on the discs received. In other cases, the titles may have been supplied based on the group of materials in which the discs arrived. The collection also contained 3 CDs that appeared to be blank, despite being labeled. These were labeled "HAFA Backup, May 10, 2008", "HAFA May 2013", and "HAFA Stuff 6/8/06".
